conclusion: To find the magnitude and direction of the resultant Ampere force acting on the trapezoidal frame.
The resistance R of a wire is given by R = ρL/S.
The resistance of each side is R_ab = R_bc = R_cd = ρL/S.
Sides ab and cd are in parallel, and bc is in series with the parallel combination.
The equivalent resistance R_parallel of ab and cd in parallel is ρL/2S.
The total equivalent resistance R_eq is 3ρL/2S.
Using Ohm's Law, the current I through the circuit is I = E/R_eq.
The Ampere force F on a current-carrying wire in a magnetic field is given by F = BIL.
The force on each side is F_ab = F_bc = F_cd = 2BSE/3ρ.
Using the right-hand rule, determine the direction of the forces.
F_ab and F_cd are directed inward, F_bc is directed outward.
F_ab and F_cd cancel each other out, the resultant force is due to F_bc.
The magnitude of the resultant Ampere force is 2BSE/3ρ.
The direction of the resultant force is perpendicular to the plane of the frame and directed outward.
